roleset.name: to block with a barricade, or to keep in or out of somewhere with a barricade
roleset.note: BARRICADE-V NOTES: Location is assigned Arg3 rather than ArgM-Loc because it occursfrequently with this verb. (from barricade.01-v)

example.name: active
example.text: That was after he had actually barricaded himself inside that bus with the child .

example.name: instrument as subject
example.text: The truck drew fire after [*PRO*] driving past a security checkpoint and through a wall barricading the buildings .
